description.narrative: By the end of 2019, the CREDD and ODD coordination bodies and related structures have the capacity to use analyses on child multi- dimensional poverty and on child-sensitive budgeting in their planning., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: [Social Policy and Inclusion]: By 2019, national and sub-national social policies are more inclusive and equitable, promoting the resilience of families and vulnerable communities.

mailing-address.narrative: BP 96 Niamakoro Route de l'Aeroport Bamako

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2019, the CREDD and ODD coordination bodies and related structures have the capacity to use analyses on child multi- dimensional poverty and on child-sensitive budgeting in their planning.

description.narrative: In 2019, with UNICEF support, the 2018 MODA, which includes information on child multidimensional poverty and monetary poverty and different deprivations of children by age groups, was published. It informed the development of the Mali-UNICEF Country Programme 2020-2024 based on the life-cycle approach. A key achievement is the inclusion by the Government of these measures in the 2018 baseline SDG report for Mali. Data on the share of social services in the national budget in 2019 is not available – it is at 5.1 per cent for health, and 8.6 per cent for basic and secondary education. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:07/02/2020
